discoveries.description: A previously unknown population of giant otters (Pteronura brasiliensis) was discovered in the Amazon River Basin, providing insight into the species' habitat and range.
Scientists discovered a new species of Brazil nut tree (Bertholletia excelsa) that helped deepen the understanding of Amazonian biodiversity.
Research uncovered details of the reproductive habits of the Amazon River pink dolphin (Inia geoffrensis), shedding light on their mating behaviors and seasonal cycles.

discoveries.discovery: Carbon Sequestration Capacity of Amazonian Trees
discoveries.description: A study revealed that the Amazon rainforest stores more carbon than previously estimated, playing a vital role in global climate regulation.
A new species of monkey, Mura's Tamarin (Saguinus mura), was discovered in the remote rainforests of the Amazon, expanding knowledge of primate diversity.
Researchers discovered a unique fungus, Pestalotiopsis microspora, in the Amazon Rainforest capable of breaking down polyurethane, a common plastic, offering potential for bioremediation.
A new species of predatory ant, Tyrannomyrmex rex, was discovered, named after the fearsome Tyrannosaurus rex due to its aggressive behavior.

discoveries.discovery: The Role of Amazon Rainforest in Nitrogen Cycle
discoveries.description: Studies highlighted the Amazon Rainforest's crucial role in the global nitrogen cycle, particularly through nitrogen-fixing trees.

discoveries.discovery: New River System Underneath the Amazon
discoveries.description: Scientists discovered a massive underground river system beneath the Amazon River, called the Hamza River, which flows at great depths and contributes to the region's hydrology.
Research showed that jaguars in the Amazon have adapted to hunt aquatic prey, including fish and caimans, demonstrating the species' adaptability and intelligence.
Several new species of orchids were discovered in the Amazon Rainforest, highlighting the region's rich biodiversity.
The giant fish Arapaima gigas, long thought to be on the brink of extinction, was rediscovered in several Amazonian rivers, offering hope for its conservation.
